verses.roman:
kata dina rahi' miśra gelā para-loka
mātā-putra duṅhāra bāḍila hṛdi śoka

synonyms: kata dina—some days; rahi'-remaining; miśra—Jagannātha Miśra; gelā—passed away; para-loka—for the transcendental world; mātā—mother; putra—son; duṅhāra—of both of them; bāḍila—increased; hṛdi—in the hearts; śoka—lamentation.
translation: After some days, Jagannātha Miśra passed away from this world to the transcendental world, and both mother and son were very much aggrieved in their hearts.
